interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Graffiti Bridge Review Date: 2016/07/02 Store: Prince (Actor, Director, Writer), Morris Day (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Music Artists, Prince Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Graffiti Bridge (DVD)', 'In a sequel of sorts to Purple Rain, the artist formerly known as Princestruggles musically with Morris Day for control of the nightclub thatthe two co-own in this dramatic musical fantasy. There is the power offaith--in oneself and in a higher power. There is the power of love.There is the never-ending struggle between good and bad. And there isthe power of music. Graffiti Bridge.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "A sort of fairy-tale sequel to Prince's enormously successful", 'Purple Rain', ", 1990's", 'Graffiti Bridge', "finds his purple highness not only singing and acting, but writing and directing, too. His performance suffers on all fronts. The film isn't a disaster, but it's safe to predict completist fans will make up most of its viewers. In the earlier film, Prince (known as the Kid) was fighting for his place on stage. This time he's fighting to keep his club safe from the money-grubbing hands of his musical rival, the Time's Morris Day, now a nightclub mogul. Day embodies spiritual, sexual, and economic corruption, while the Kid stands for salvation through music and a more redemptive form of lust.", 'The graffiti bridge conceit--a metaphor for a place of rejuvenation and artistic inspiration--is intriguing. Unfortunately, the bridge itself is merely a prop in a Paisley Park soundstage. Where', 'Purple Rain', 'was a movie that set new standards for lensing musical performances,', 'Graffiti Bridge', 'feels like a music video masquerading as a movie. Lucky for us, Prince cast the honey-voiced poet and performer Ingrid Chavez as Aura, part muse and part angel to both Day and the Kid. Her beauty and charisma ignite every frame she graces.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'Set Contains:', 'Bonus features are minimal but apt: a surprisingly good movie trailer and a quartet of relevant music videos, three drawn from the film and one, "Question of U," a characteristically electric concert clip.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'See more'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Musicals & Performing Arts/Musicals, Drama', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Phillip C, Morris Day, Damon Dickson, Levi Seacer Jr., Kirk Johnson, Ingrid Chavez, Miko Weaver, Prince, Jerome Benton, The Time, Rosie Gaines, Michael Bland, Tony MosleyPhillip C, Morris Day, Damon Dickson, Levi Seacer Jr., Kirk Johnson, Ingrid Chavez, Miko Weaver, Prince, Jerome Benton, The Time, Rosie Gaines, Michael Bland, Tony Mosley See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 4.0)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Prince', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Prince, Morris Day, Jerome Benton, Ingrid Chavez, The Time', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Prince', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I, along with the rest of the world was devastated when his Royal Purple Badness, Prince Rogers Nelson passed away on 4.21.16 so I wanted to have his movies on dvd ( i had them all on vhs. Haha) and it was just what I needed. This isnt the greatest film but I enjoy it because it's Prince-what can i say?

It was nice to see him reprise his roll as The Kid but it is not as visually appealing and sexy or dramatic as Purple Rain or funny and cinematic as Under the Cherry Moon. Review Title: Prince can do no wrong. Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Movie Preferences**: Strong appreciation for classic films and those with significant cultural themes. The user enjoys films by influential artists, especially appreciating the artistry and narratives crafted by iconic figures in the industry.

- **Genres**: Likely enjoys musical dramas and films with a strong connection to music and performance, along with foreign films or those showcasing diverse cultural backgrounds.

- **Key Influencers**: Has a specific affinity for works involving renowned musicians and directors, valuing impactful storytelling through their unique artistic lenses. The user is particularly drawn to films featuring celebrated performers.

- **Format**: Prefers special edition formats that enhance the viewing experience, including features like closed-captioning and director’s cuts, which align with a discerning approach to media consumption.

- **Social Connections**: Shares film experiences with family and friends, indicating a tendency to gift media with personal significance, strengthening connections with loved ones.

- **Rating Behavior**: Consistently gives high ratings (5.0) and expresses satisfaction with purchases, reflecting a discerning and appreciative taste in quality storytelling and cinematic experiences.

- **Overall Engagement**: Engages actively through media purchases and thoughtful reviews, demonstrating a passion for classic storytelling, music-infused narratives, and a lifelong connection to memorable filmmakers and musical icons.
